name: Introduction to Cultural Studies
description: This course introduces students to the field of Cultural Studies, including the history, theory, and practice of the field.

name: Social Movements and Activism
description: This course covers the history and theory of social movements and activism, as well as practical techniques and strategies for successful engagement.

name: Diversity and Multiculturalism
description: This course examines the concept of diversity and its history, as well as the contemporary socio-political realities that shape multiculturalism.

name: Race and Ethnicity
description: This course examines the concepts of race and ethnicity in the United States, exploring historical and contemporary contexts of power and privilege.

name: Critical Race Theory
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of Critical Race Theory, exploring its history, methodology, and contemporary debates.
